intro: Prinsepia nanhutashanense, commonly known as the Nanhutashan rose, is a rare shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with well-drained soil and partial shade. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or white, and it produces small, edible berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
